meanings.definition: To throw or toss something with a quick motion.
meanings.sent1: I will chuck the ball to you.
meanings.sent2: He likes to chuck stones into the pond.
meanings.sent3: She chuckled as she tried to chuck the heavy bag.
meanings.sent4: The wind can chuck the leaves around like a playful child.
meanings.sent5: Remember to chuck the garbage into the bin with care.

meanings.definition: A cut of beef taken from the shoulder.
meanings.sent1: The chef prepared a delicious chuck steak for dinner.
meanings.sent2: I prefer using chuck for my beef stew.
meanings.sent3: The chuck looked so tender and juicy at the butcher's shop.
meanings.sent4: The chuck sizzled on the grill, filling the air with a mouthwatering aroma.
meanings.sent5: The chuck roast was the highlight of the barbecue party.

meanings.definition: A device used to hold a workpiece in place in a lathe or other machine tool.
meanings.sent1: The chuck securely held the metal rod in place.
meanings.sent2: He adjusted the chuck to fit the piece he was working on.
meanings.sent3: The mechanic's favorite tool was the sturdy chuck.
meanings.sent4: The precision of the chuck ensured the perfect alignment of the workpiece.
meanings.sent5: The old chuck had served him well through many projects.

meanings.definition: A friendly or affectionate term for a person's chin.
meanings.sent1: The baby's chubby chuck was irresistible.
meanings.sent2: Grandma always pinched my chuck lovingly.
meanings.sent3: He planted a gentle kiss on her chuck.
meanings.sent4: The dimple on her chuck added to her charm.
meanings.sent5: His beard tickled her chuck when he hugged her.
